Opening the Sample Project Database

The sample project database contains a variety of files for two projects: chess and bridge. Use the sample project database to practice Serena ChangeMan Version Manager tasks and to complete the tutorials in the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager Getting Started Guide. For more information on the contents of the sample project database and tasks you can perform, see About the Sample Project Database.

On Windows

By default, the sample project database is installed in a location relative to the Version Manager installation location, such as drive:\Program Files\Serena\VM\common\SampleDB, where drive is the default Windows drive.

On UNIX

You can choose to install or to not install the sample project database when you install Version Manager on UNIX. If you choose to install it, the sample project database is installed in a location relative to Version Manager, such as /usr/serena/vm/common/sampledb.

If you did not select the Open the Version Manager sample project database check box in the Welcome to Serena ChangeMan Version Manager dialog box the first time you logged in to Version Manager, see the instructions below for opening the sample project database.

To open the sample project database:

  1. Select File | Open Project Database. The Open Project Database dialog box appears.

  2. Navigate to the directory that contains the sample project database. If you've installed Version Manager in the default location, the directories for both Windows and UNIX installations are listed at the top of this topic. If you cannot find the sample project database, contact your Administrator.

  3. Select the SampleDB directory and click OK. The Login dialog box appears.

  4. Enter Admin in the User Name field and leave the Password field blank.

  5. Click OK. The sample project database opens in the Project pane of the Version Manager window.
